headline: Regulator Files Charges In New Zealand Eruption That Left 22 People Dead
text: WELLINGTON, New Zealand — Almost one year to the day after a deadly volcanic eruption killed 22 people on New Zealand’s White Island, the country’s workplace safety regulator has charged a number of organizations and individuals for their roles in the disaster.
snippet: Government agencies and individuals were among those charged over the roles in the 2019 disaster, which killed 22 people.
